column2: Job Title:  Mathematics (Arithmetic) Lecturer Location:  Nalanda Degree College, Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh, India Job Type:  Full-Time/Part-Time About Our College: Renowned institution committed to excellence in higher education. Emphasis on innovative teaching and research in the field of mathematics. Job Summary:  Nalanda Degree College is seeking a passionate and qualified Lecturer (Mathematics) to join its growing department. The selected candidate will be responsible for delivering engaging lectures, developing course curricula, and fostering a love for mathematics in students. Job Description: Deliver comprehensive and engaging mathematics curriculum focusing on arithmetic and related mathematical principles. Foster a deep understanding of arithmetic concepts and their practical applications. Prepare students for successful careers in fields requiring strong mathematical skills. Responsibilities:  The key responsibilities of the Lecturer (Mathematics) will include the following: Curriculum Delivery: Design and execute interactive mathematics lectures and lab sessions on various arithmetic topics, including: Number Systems Fractions and Decimals Ratio and Proportion Percentage Profit and Loss Simple and Compound Interest Time, Work, and Distance Algebraic Expressions Geometry and Measurement Data Interpretation Problem-Solving Techniques Lesson Planning: Develop detailed lesson plans aligned with university guidelines and industry standards. Stay updated on the latest advancements in mathematics and integrate them into the curriculum. Student Assessment: Evaluate student progress through assignments, projects, and exams; maintain accurate academic records. Classroom Management: Maintain discipline and foster a collaborative and inclusive learning environment. Parental Engagement: Engage with parents/guardians as needed to discuss student progress and address concerns. Professional Development: Pursue continuous professional development and engage in collaborative research with colleagues. Contribute to the overall development of the mathematics department. Qualifications:  To be considered for the position of Lecturer (Mathematics), the candidate must have the following qualifications: Founder Level: 1-3 years of experience in teaching mathematics, Masters degree in Mathematics, and B.Ed. Master Level: 4-8 years of experience, Masters degree in Mathematics, and B.Ed or M.Ed. Developer Level: 9+ years of experience, Masters degree in Mathematics or related field, and M.Ed or Ph.D. Additional Qualifications: Masters degree in Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field (M.Sc. Mathematics). Minimum of 3 to 5 years of teaching experience in mathematics at the undergraduate level (preferred). Maximum of 10 to 15 years of relevant teaching or industry experience (desirable). Strong foundation in arithmetic and related mathematical principles. Working knowledge of advanced mathematical concepts (a plus). Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Ability to create a positive and engaging learning environment. Passion for teaching and a commitment to student success. Key Skills: Arithmetic:  Proficiency in teaching number systems, fractions, decimals, ratio, proportion, percentage, and problem-solving techniques. Algebra and Geometry:  Understanding of algebraic expressions and geometric measurements. Data Interpretation:  Ability to teach and interpret various data sets. Communication:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal Skills:  Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and engage effectively with students. Presentation Skills:  Ability to deliver clear and engaging lectures. Adaptability:  Willingness to learn and integrate new technologies and teaching methods. Research and Development:  Capability to contribute to academic research and departmental development. Screening Process: Written Test:  Subject-specific exam in mathematics. Proficiency Test:  Assessment of MS Office skills. Reading Test:  Conducted via Microsoft Teams. Teaching Demonstration:  Mock classroom session. Benefits: Competitive compensation and benefits. Opportunities for professional growth and development. Supportive and collaborative work environment.
column11: Mathematical Problem-Solving, Algebra and Geometry, Arithmetic Proficiency, Professional Development, Data Interpretation, Adaptability, Classroom Management, Student Assessment, Curriculum Development, Communication, Interpersonal Skills

column2: Role & responsibilities     Job Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Math Teacher to join our team at Bangalore English High School in Bangalore, India. The successful candidate will be responsible for teaching Primary school math subjects to students in grades 5-7th std. The ideal candidate will have a passion for teaching, a strong subject knowledge, and the ability to engage and inspire students. Key Responsibilities: Develop and deliver engaging and effective lesson plans that align with the school's curriculum and standards. Use a variety of teaching methods and techniques to help students understand mathematical concepts and solve problems. Assess student learning and progress using a range of assessment tools. Provide timely and constructive feedback to students on their academic performance. Communicate effectively with parents, colleagues, and school leadership to ensure a collaborative and positive learning environment. Participate in school-wide events and initiatives, such as parent-teacher conferences, student clubs, and professional development activities. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's (BSc) or Master's degree (MSc) in Mathematics or a related field. B.Ed. or M.Ed. degree is preferred. Minimum of 3 years of teaching experience in a similar role Excellent subject knowledge and a passion for teaching math. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and school leadership. Familiarity with technology tools and platforms for teaching and learning.   If you are a passionate and dedicated Math Teacher with the skills and experience required for this position, we encourage you to apply. We offer a competitive salary package and opportunities for professional development and growth. Industry Type: Education / Training Department: Teaching & Training Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent Role Category: Subject / Specialization Teacher
column11: Mathematics, Teaching Mathematics, Teaching

column2: If youre interested in turning your passion into a rewarding career, then its time to join our team of highly skilled tutors. If you find yourself to be the right candidate, you may apply for the job and become a part of Mathademys team of professional tutors.   Who Can Apply      Graduates with minimum 1 year of teaching experience in Maths for grades 1-12         Must have good knowledge of Mathematics and teaching skills.         Must be able to communicate effectively and flexibly with students having different learning styles.         Must be able to teach the subject and measure the students performance and absorb the feedback to enhance his/her quality of work or teaching.         Must be flexible in carrying out his/her responsibilities given to him or her and must work creatively on them.         Must be willing to transmit his/her knowledge of the subject to the student in a thorough manner, for it to be best suited to the students understanding.     Roles and Responsibilities      One-on-One Mathematics Tutoring to students at their home and Online.         Educational content development.

column1: Mathematics Subject Leader & Lead Pastoral Care
column2: Head of the Department Mathematics & Pastoral lead Role Profile   Purpose of Role   Hiring Mathematics HOD for Mathematics Department & pastoral lead with formal teaching experience at school into IGCSE for AS Level. To ensure high standards of teaching and learning of mathematics are delivered as set out in the curriculum in accordance with Cambridge (CAIE) and school policy. Planning of the curriculum content, ensuring it is well sequenced to promote pupil progress. Ensure the planned curriculum is effectively and consistently implemented across the school.  Manthan and ISP Principles   Begin with our children and students.  Our children and students are at the heart of what we do. Simply, their success is our success. Wellbeing and safety are both essential for learners and learning. Therefore, we are consistent in identifying potential safeguarding and Health & Safety issues and acting and following up on all concerns appropriately.  Treat everyone with care and respect.  We look after one another, embrace similarities and differences and promote the well-being of self and others.  Operate effectively.  We focus relentlessly on the things that are most important and will make the most difference. We apply school policies and procedures and embody the shared ideas of our community.  Are financially responsible.  We make financial choices carefully based on the needs of the children, students and our schools.  Learn continuously.  Getting better is what drives us. We positively engage in personal and professional development and school improvement.   Mathematics HOD Key Roles and Responsibilities   Roles & Responsibilities of Subject Leader   Oversee the planning of the curriculum content, ensuring it is well sequenced to promote pupil progress.  Ensure the planned curriculum is effectively and consistently implemented across the school.  Teach and guide students.  Mentoring teachers by reviewing their lesson plans, suggesting innovative ideas to incorporate in the class, and  observing their classrooms. Also, checking on the quality of teaching provided to the students.  The samples of corrected notebooks by the teachers are also reviewed.  Reviewing quality of textbooks and material created by content team.  Reviewing the corrected assessments of the teachers and providing them with appropriate feedback.  Providing guidance to the content team in the creation of effective reading materials and assessments that  improve students' skills.  Supporting, training, and reviewing of teacher created learning material.  Guiding the content in the process of updating the curriculum  Liaising with other Leaders, Student Support Services and relevant staff with cross-School responsibilities,  relevant non-teaching support staff.  Responsible for Teaching staff and other relevant personnel within the Subject Area  Interviewing and training new employees, as well as guiding them through the Manthan ethos and procedure.  Training of teachers  Planning and conducting staff meetings  Encouraging teachers to attend relevant training.  Teacher evaluation/pupils Display visual evidence, photographs, ICT etc.  To keep up to date with national developments in the Subject Area and teaching practice and methodology  Annual performance review of teachers  Make sure the quality of lesson plans, etc made by teachers is good.  Classroom observations done by SLs to understand the teaching process of the teachers and guide them  accordingly.  Organizing the Subject weeks like Srijan, Literati, Samnavay etc. with the help of the subject teachers.  Guiding the teachers through the PTMs as well, how they should address a query regarding a subject.  Taking interviews and demonstration session as part of recruitment cycle  Preparing content and designing assessments  Training the students for inter-house competitions.  Ensuring proper usage and maintenance of Lab resources & material  Skills, Qualifications and Experience   Most have a Masters degree in Mathematics   Must have teaching experience of Further mathematics  Excellent communication skills  Good conceptual understanding  Effective classroom management skills  Should have previous experience of teaching Mathematics in CAIE/IB programs / CBSE  Bachelors degree in education for CBSE curriculum  Ability to engage the class and create a learning environment  12-15 years of experience as a High School Teacher, Min 7 Years as a AS level mathematics teacher.   Candidates with experience in handling special needs dept, PE dept , Activities team and  Textbook Finalization and Stationery room management. will be preferred.   Leadership Competencies   You consistently demonstrate and role-model the ISP Leadership Competencies in all that you do.  Takes an active part in leading their school or region; is cooperative and a genuine team player, developing positive, supportive relationships with colleagues to solve problems and maximize opportunities.  Learning & Getting Better.  Continually demonstrates personal commitment and passion for learning and getting better using evidence and feedback; supporting others in their continual learning, development and growth.  Innovation Leadership.  Is good at creating an environment where ideas for learning initiatives and services are generated and is able to motivate and inspire others through the process of creation through to completion.  Outcome driven.  Can be counted on to find solutions. Is consistently looking to exceed goals and is focused on KPIs.  Can deal with setbacks and challenges calmly and effectively.  Community Focus.  Is committed to meeting and exceeding the needs and expectations of our students and their families.  Integrity & Ethical Management.  Has the ability to work ethically and with integrity; helps others feel valued; upholds and models the ISP Vision, Purpose and Principles.  Leading & Inspiring Others.  Supports, encourages and inspires students, colleagues and teams so that they give their best.  Understanding People.  Is a very good judge of talent, can objectively articulate the strengths and motivations of people inside or outside the organisation.  Influencing & Communication.  Consistently informs, influences and inspires students, parents and colleagues through timely and effective communication.  Responds and adapts to changing circumstances; manages and solves problems by providing solutions in a climate of ambiguity.  Strategic, Commercial & Financial Awareness.  Has the ability to apply understanding of the business and industry to improve effectiveness and profitability.  Planning & Decision Making.  Makes decisions on the best course of action and then plans, organises, prioritises and balances resources to achieve the desired outcome.  Diversity & Equity.  Has the sensitivity, awareness and skill to understand the values, behaviors, attitudes and practices across cultures that supports all children and adults to learn and work effectively.  Manthan and ISP Commitment to Safeguarding Principles  ISP is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. All postholders are subject to appropriate vetting procedures and satisfactory Criminal Background Checks or equivalent covering the previous 10 years employment history.  Manthan and ISP Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging    ISP is committed to strengthening our inclusive culture by identifying, hiring, developing, and retaining high-performing teammates regardless of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation and gender expression, age, disability status, neurodivergence, socio-economic background or other demographic characteristics. Candidates who share our vision and principles and are interested in contributing to the success of ISP through this role are strongly encouraged to apply.

column2: Support and delivery of content of high school Advanced Math required for international curricula (Calculus and statistics, Differential equations, Further Math, Number Theory) in the ed-tech environment.     Excellent knowledge and delivery required for International Math Competitions (Olympiad level) will be helpful         Job Requirements         M.Sc. Mathematics or Applied Maths/ B.Tech. or M. Tech Computer Science/ highly meritorious B.ScMath Honours student.     Excellent content knowledge and a good track record as a bright Math student from high school through university     Good in written and verbal communication skills.     Capable and passionate about math teaching         Following will be an added advantage:         Knowledge of graphing and geometry software GeoGebra, Desmos, Excel, R., Math Writing- Latex and Math Type, Computing language.     Having exposure or qualified in Olympiad and NTSE     Exposure to international programmes as a STEM student would be highly considered for the position.     Studied in international curricula (IB, Cambridge, Advanced Placement) or international universities         Note:    Based on the performance during this internship period, interns can be absorbed for a full-time position of assistant instructor/Instructors       Courses for Internship         Pre-IB Diploma Programme Math Courses (May July)     Other Math IB Diploma Programme (HL) courses (Throughout the year)         International Math Competitions: (through the year)      American Math Competitions (AMC 10/12) (June-Nov)     American Math Competitions (AMC 8) (Sept-Jan)     CEMC (Jan-Feb)     American Invitational Mathematics Examination (Dec)     Math Summer Prep Course (Dec-Jan)             High School Accelerator Courses:      Math: Art of Problem Solving (March-April / Jul-Aug)

column2: Rajeev Classes Educational Institutes PVT LTD is looking for Maths Faculty to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey. We are looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic Mathematics Faculty member to join our educational institution. As a Mathematics Faculty, you will play a vital role in imparting mathematical knowledge and skills to students, fostering their understanding, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities. Your passion for mathematics and effective teaching methods will contribute to creating a positive learning environment and nurturing the academic growth of our students.       Key Responsibilities:       Course Delivery:Design and deliver engaging and comprehensive mathematics lessons to students at various levels, ensuring alignment with the curriculum and learning objectives.Present mathematical concepts in a clear and understandable manner, using appropriate teaching aids and methods.     Student Engagement:Foster a stimulating classroom environment that encourages student participation, discussions, and critical thinking.Provide individualized attention to students and offer support to address their learning needs.     Assessment and Evaluation:Develop quizzes, assignments, and assessments to evaluate students' comprehension and progress in the subject.Provide timely feedback on assignments and assessments to guide students' improvement.     Curriculum Development:Collaborate with other faculty members to develop and enhance the mathematics curriculum, incorporating relevant real-world applications and advancements in the field.     Mentorship and Guidance:Serve as an academic mentor to students, offering guidance on academic and career paths related to mathematics.Provide support for students participating in mathematics competitions or projects.     Professional Development:Stay updated on the latest developments in the field of mathematics, teaching methodologies, and educational technologies.Participate in workshops, seminars, and conferences to enhance teaching skills.     Research and Publications:Conduct research in mathematics or related areas and contribute to academic publications, if applicable
